XRRay.summary: NOTE Experimental The XRRay interface of the WebXR Device API is a geometric ray described by an origin point and a direction vector.

remarks.para: XRRay objects can be passed to or to perform hit testing.

XRRayOrigin.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only origin property of the interface is a representing the 3-dimensional point in space that the ray originates from, in meters.

XRRayXRRay.summary: NOTE Experimental The XRRay() constructor creates a new object which is a geometric ray described by an origin point and a direction vector.

XRRayMatrix.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only matrix property of the interface is a transform that can be used to position objects along the XRRay. This is a 4 by 4 matrix given as a 16 element in column major order.

remarks.para: The transform from a ray originates at [0, 0, 0] and extends down the negative z-axis to the ray described by the XRRay's origin and direction.

XRRayMatrix.value: A 16 element object representing a 4 by 4 matrix in column major order.

XRRayDirection.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only direction property of the interface is a representing the ray's 3-dimensional directional vector, normalized to a unit vector with a length of 1.0.
